content.question: Which of the following statements best explains how a condition of Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium results in a population that exhibits stable allele frequencies (i.e., a nonevolving population) ?

choices.label: Large populations are not subject to natural selection.
Random mating prevents gene flow from changing allele frequencies.
Without migration or mutation, new alleles cannot be introduced to the population.
In the absence of selection, allele frequencies in a population will not change.

content.answer: Without migration or mutation, new alleles cannot be introduced to the population.
